intro: Eriocaulon trisectoides, commonly known as the three-lobed star sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in humid and shaded conditions. Its flowers are usually inconspicuous, with tiny, three-lobed structures that contribute to its scientific name. Eriocaulon trisectoides plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
